data.title: Al Pastor Tacos
data.text: Like all of the other reviews state, the al pastor tacos were amazing. It was probably the best taco I have ever had. They were making the tortillas fresh right there. She had a giant bowl of dough and she hand cranked it through a little machine that cut out the circles. Then she put the circles on the grill. So fresh. I also ordered a chicken Sope. It was really good but the tacos are amazing.

data.title: Eat here
data.text: The best authentic Mexican tacos around. I love the pork. Small hole in the wall mom and pop place that needs more servers but it has the best food. Prices are very reasonable.

data.title: Al pastor
data.text: Go and get the tacos al pastor , that is what they are known for. They provide fast service and food.

data.title: al pastor
data.text: You'll know immediately that you're in the right place when you see the pineapple topped spinning cone of meat. Small restaurant and so very fresh! Order the al pastor. They will bring you a giant plate with melted cheese and tortillas that haven't seen an hour pass since they were hand made. A must for foodies and taco lovers everywhere.

data.title: Best Authentic Mexican - Burrito to die for
data.text:
This place is awesome.  From the outside it seems like a little whole in the wall with not much to offer - but the food is incredible.   There street tacos are the real thing.  Incredible flavor and spices.  Their salsa is a bit overwhelming but SO GOOD.   Their Pastor Burrito is my favorite thing in all of Kansas City.   Words cannot describe how awesome it is.  If I had to choose between a Z-man and El Camino's Pastor Burrito the Burrito would win everytime.   This Burrito needs it's own T-SHIRT!!!   

The only downside to this restaurant is that there is absolutely NO PARKING.  Unless you are one of the two lucky people to grab a spot right in front of the building then you should plan on parking a block or two away and walking.
  

El Camino is easily in my top 5 of authentic Mexican Restraurants in KCK.

data.title: Awesome!
data.text: Ok so it's a hole in the wall location but talk about amazing authentic Mexican food! Loved it! Felt so homey. So cool to watch them working while we ate.

data.title: HEAVEN
data.text: For those who want to have some REAL authentic Mexican food you must come to this restaurant! The food is some of the best i have ever tasted and i have been to plenty of Mexican restaurants (counting at home with home made Mexican food). The tortillas are made fresh right there by hand and the cook is constantly working up something delicious. It feels like you walked into a little restaurant in Mexico and it's very small. I highly recommend going once and if you don't like the food then at least you tried. But please stop by for a bite, you won't regret it.

data.title: Good Tacos, Authentic street Taco
data.text: Enjoyed authentic street tacos.  Very small simple restaurant.  Walked 2 blocks from the hotel and glad there was a policy station across the street.  Nice small park and transportation area but lots of men walking on the streets - felt a little unsafe in this area for walking.  Food was excellent but had to make sure I did not look around with a critical eye. If you are a stickler for cleanliness this is NOT the restaurant for you.  Although I did not see anything that turned my stomach it was just very authentic like if you went into a restaurant in a Mexican Border town.  The windows and floor needed to be cleaned, I'm sure if you are looking you would find more but the center point is the grill area and meat on a rack as you enter the door.  Simple spicy food very cheap - $1.50 for tacos.  A variety of meat available, pork, beef, tongue head, fish, chicken.  No bar only bottled beer.  Guacamole was very chunky and spicy! Overall a good dinner for $7.

data.title: Awesome tacos!
data.text:
I am going to California next week but I was craving to eat tacos for lunch yesterday. One of the Mexican operators in the plant suggested me to come here saying the the taco's were good and uahu!!!!!!.... This is a very good place!!!!... the tacos are really tasty and fresh.

The first view you have from the front window is this gigantic skewer (like the one used for gyro meat) with "Al Pastor" meat and pineapple at the top... so I knew it was a good sign. When I entered, I saw the flat iron grill where they make the tacos plus a tortilla machine... yes!!!... the tortillas were made right there next to the grill. Awesome!!!.

Well... seeing that, I asked with confidence my 5 tacos (3 al pastor and 2 asadas). Sooo goood with the fresh cilantro, chopped onions and squeezed lime.

Oh!, I am so excited about the tacos that I forgot to mention the guacamole made right there in your eyes and the tortilla chips.

PS. My friends ordered other things like gorditas and burritos... I did not try them but they look as appetizing.

data.title: Food was good, but...
data.text: the service was just okay and the neighborhood a bit shady. Probably look elsewhere before returning...

data.title: Best Al Pastor
data.text:
Seriously, when you walk in you see the pastor on the rotisserie and that's really all you need to know its good. It's mouth watering goodness. Then they cradle that goodness on a couple freshly made corn tortillas. If you like true pastor, you will love it! It's hard not to just order the pastor but the fish tacos are delicious too. 

You really can't go wrong with anything here.

data.title: Delicious enchiladas
data.text: I was part of a group of nine people visiting for Thursday lunch.  While I was surprised to find that the restaurant couldn't serve margaritas at 2PM, and some of the members of our group were a bit turned off by the loud television and the somewhat cluttered appearance of the place, my food was delicious, and no question my wife and I would return if we lived in KC.  She had a couple of a la carte items: a gordita and a taco.  I loved the four-enchilada platter with mole.  I switched out the chicken for beef and enjoyed the fact that rather than just cheese, onion, and meat, the cook at El Camino stuffed my enchiladas with potato, corn, tomato, and carrot.  The mole sauce was delicious, as were the rice and beans.  The portion size was enormous for just $10.95, and I ate every bite, surprised at myself but glad we'd tried this spot.  If you can get past the appearance of the place, the food won't disappoint.

data.title: Get the Hawaiian pork dish
data.text:
My Hawaiian pork dish was excellent. The others at my table all tasted it and agreed it was the best.
We were there on a Saturday evening. There was a sign posted for Margaritas 2 for $5.99. When we tried to order them we were told that they could not sell alcohol until Monday. 
The restuarant has a juke box with all songs in Spanish
Small family run place

data.title: Great Tacos Al Pastor
data.text: They have awesome tacos al pastor! I can't comment on anything else because its the only thing I ever order!  They make the tortillas right in front of you!  Tacos go great with the classic Horchata drink!

data.title: Exceptional Authentic Mexican Food
data.text: I love, love El Camino Real. The food is legit Mexican food. The pastor tacos are amazing. The horchata is delicious. This restaurant is not for someone looking for tex mex enchiladas covered in cheese and red sauce. The food is fresh and consistently good. Great place to bring family and friends in town visiting.

data.title: Totally authentic
data.text: I'm far from an expert on authenticity, but the food here reminds me of tacos I've had in Mexico on vacation -- in a good way. The pastor seems to be the draw, and it is excellent, but don't overlook the tongue which is also great. You can't beat these prices, either. Don't expect much in terms of atmosphere, and come prepared to speak at least a little Spanglish if need be, but you won't beat this food.

data.title: Legit Mexican
data.text: The atmosphere and overall decorations inside are not very great, but the Mexican food was nothing but 100% authentic! The tacos are delicious and actual spice -- it was great! Everything is freshly prepared and the flavor gets better and better every time. Lots of choices on the menu and the prices are really great. As well the beer there goes perfectly along with the spice and delicious food options. The waiters are always really nice and helpful. Absolutely worth a visit!

data.title: Best al Pastor Tacos in Kansas City
data.text:
When we left Kansas City for San Francisco El Camino Real was one of the few things we knew we would miss. We found a pretty good taco truck in SF, but we never found a restaurant there that could beat or even match El Camino for pastor tacos. And unlike many other places, El Camino makes their own corn tortillas, which really adds to the overall flavor of the taco; those small pre-made taco shells most restaurants serve pastor on are incredibly bland. The sides El Camino serves with its tacos are always fresh and plentiful too.

One of the first things we did when we moved back to KC was head to El Camino Real. In fact, we're going again for lunch today.

data.title: Two Visits, both Very Good
data.text: Not a Tex Mex place...just good authentic mexican.  Go for the tacos.  I have tried most of them and the el pastor is awesome as it is cut fresh right from the giant mound in the front window.  Picadiilo, carnitas, pollo and lengua were all very good as well.  I asked for some a bowl of the salsa verde to dip the chips in.

data.title: Best little restaurant in Kansas City, Kansas
data.text: The tacos are authentic. They have specials on beer and tacos. The best are the steak tacos with all the fixings.
